comment: Took her back in 2017. Loved her teaching methods as she was very helpful. Ask a question, and she'll answer; no disrespect. Pretty funny at times too! I do remember having to use myMathLab, so keep that in mind (all it was used for was homework). Attendance was NOT mandatory, BUT she did randomly choose days to give extra credit.
I took her at chattahoochee tech. She teaches extremely fast and does not go over the problems well. Don't take her class if you are not naturally gifted in math.

1 quiz, homework, 4 tests and a final. The final replaces your lowest test grade, and the final was quite easy. She can't teach to save her life. If you need to be taught math, take anyone else. Class lasts all of 30 minutes, if you choose to go at all. Not accessible outside of class and no set office hours. Posts test reviews and uses MyMathLab.
Here class literally lasts 20 minutes every lecture. If your great at math shes perfect for you but if you need to actually be taught do not take her.

Attendance is not necessary. She puts all her powerpoint online. Your homework is on Mymathlab and she does not require you to get the textbook. You have 4 test and your final replaces your lowest grade. Very easy class

If you are anything like me do not take her! I need someone who teaches math and she does not. She goes over things very quickly and then class is over. I have had to teach myself this material and have struggled. I go to class everyday even those attendance is. not mandatory and I still have a hard time learning the material. She is a good person.

Prof Goss is really cool and I genuinely enjoy her as a person. However, she flies through her lectures in usually about 30 minutes and when I get home and try to do my homework I often rely on mymathlab to teach the lesson for me instead. She has a great sense of humor and she's super sweet, but I guess I just don't learn well with how she teaches

She is honestly such a good teacher. Only teaches at night since she teaches highs school as well which sucks but her classes always get out early anyways. She is such a good teacher and always has an answer to your questions. I loved her and would recommend taking her. Very easy class if you just show up and listen. Homework is all on my math lab.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: SHE IS THE BEST! It is so important to have a good math teacher, so if you are stressed about Algebra like I was then you need to take her! She explains the content as many times as you need! She is really good at showing respect and making sure that everyone understands! SERIOUSLY FIGHT TO GET THIS PROFESSOR!!

Ms. Goss is amazing! The lectures are straightforward and easy to follow. Class will always end early. The homework is on my math lab which is easy. The tests are not hard as long as you can use a calculator and understand the concepts. GET A TI-84. It will save your grade! Take her if you are not good at math! She will make it so easy.

Prof Goss is great. She gets straight to the point and usually dismisses the class as soon as she's finished and she offers to stay after for anyone who needs help and throughout her lectures she checks to see if anyone has any questions. Teaches the material well, tests are not hard at all if you study.

Please don't do it to yourself. Didn't demonstrate even when asked to do so  how to plug in a formula into Ti-84. Every time I asked someone if they understood class, they would always tell me "No but I just go home & teach myself anyway". Sad to say but we all paid an entire semester to teach ourselves math AFTER we attended class. UGH.

She does not care about attendance but if you show up sometimes you get extra credit because of how little people are in class. Kind of knows what she is talking about. Not the greatest teacher but what i did not understand in class i understood through MyMathLab.

She is very charismatic. Great on whiteboard. Does not know TI calculators -says so. You are really left to teaching yourself through text, MyMathLab, and tutors(if avail.) College Algebra 1111 is identical book and material - take it. I dropped this class at drop deadline, and pick-up MATH 1111 next semester for an 'A'. Paid twice, but saved GPA.
She is an amazing teacher. I loved her. She's hilarious, the whole class laughs when she makes a joke. She ends class early almost everyday when she finishes her lecture. She doesn't take attendance.

She was a nice prefoessor overrall and tried helping. When I mean by tried helping she didn't even know the material. I was left teaching the material to myself at the end of the day. She did not even know the answers to her tests. I barely passed her class. The only great thing she did for us was change our last test grade with the final grade.
